Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam. Pamela. Pam-elama-ding-dong. Making copies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not making any copies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's go. Messages. Stat. Lots to do, lots to do. Information superhighway.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing new.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lay them on me. What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's nothing new.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not what you said earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, do you want me to repeat the messages that I gave you before for the... [nods toward camera]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The most sacred thing I do is care and provide for my workers, my family. I give them money. I give them food. Not directly, but through the money. I heal them. Today, I am in charge of picking a great new health care plan. Right? That's what this is all about. Does that make me their doctor? Um... Yes, in a way. Yeah, like a specialist.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, which health plan have you decided on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to go with the best, Jan. I am going to go with the one with the acupuncture, therapeutic massage, you know, the works.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Wait, acupuncture? None of the plans have acupuncture. Have you looked at them closely Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think it was you who didn't look closely enough at the Gold Plan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: The Gold Plan? I'm not even on that plan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'd recommend it. It's very good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You gotta crack these things open.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know the whole reason that we're doing this, is to save money. So you just need to pick a provider and choose the cheapest plan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that is kind of a tough assignment. Um... It won't be popular decision around the old orifice.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's your job. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's a suicide mission, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael... maybe... I mean...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There, there...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Sometimes a manager, like yourself, has to deliver the bad news to the employees. I do it all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [scoffs] When have you ever done that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm doing it right now. To you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Last night on Trading Spouses, there's... have you seen it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. I have a life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Interesting, what's that like?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You should try it sometime.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. But then who would watch my TV? That is...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs]... your problem.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jimbo! Ha haaaaa. Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's a decision that needs to be made, and I'm having an unbelievably a busy day. So I'm going to let you pick a health care plan for our office and then explain it to your co-workers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is a great offer. Thank you. I really think I should be concentrating on sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I just don't think this is the kind of task, that I... am going to do. You know who would be great for this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Any time Michael asks me to do anything, I just tell him that Dwight should do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. I can do it. I'm your man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right now, this is just a job. If I advance any higher in this company then this would be my career. And uh, well, if this were my career, I'd have to throw myself in front of a train.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, first, let's go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, none. You're picking a health care plan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, we'll table that for the time being. Two, I'll need an office. I think the conference room should be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can use the conference room as a temporary workspace.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to self] Yes, I have an office. [to camera] Bigger than his.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope, you cannot use it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, I take it back, it's a workspace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Temporary workspace. You can use it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If Dwight fails, then that is strike two, and good for me for, ah, for giving him a second chance. And if he succeeds, then, you know, no one will be prouder than I am. I groomed him. I made him what he is today. Unless he fails, and we've talked about that already.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone. I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don't believe in coddling people.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In the wild, there is no health care. In the wild, health care is, "Ow, I hurt my leg. I can't run. A lion eats me and I'm dead." Well, I'm not dead. I'm the lion. You're dead.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: There's no dental, there's no vision, there's a $1,200 deductible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Pam, Michael Scott. How's tricks?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I am in my office. I am swamped. I have work up to my ears I'm busy, busy, busy. Can't step away. I just wanted to check in and see how everybody's doing. Everybody cool out there?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Actually, people are really unhappy. Um, Dwight sent around this memo and people are freaking out 'cause the...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam! Whoa, whoa, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I, I, I, I gotta go. I'm getting a call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have to make a call after I finish... my work. You know what? Uh, just don't let anybody in my office under any conditions today. I'm just too busy. Too swamped, you know? I am unreachable. I am incommunicado, capisce?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Oh, gah, here we go again. Gotta go, I have to take this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Still no one calling.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, what...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, knock, please. Please knock. This is an office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It says "workspace".

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If it's the same thing, then why did you write "workspace"?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just knock, Please? As a sign of respect for your superior.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are not my superior.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh gee, then why do I have an office?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought it was a workspace?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. Dwight. Are you really in charge of picking the health care plan?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. And my decision in final.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is a ridiculously awful plan. Because you cut everything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aww, times are tough, Pam. Deal with it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You cut more than you had to, didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, why did you do that? You work here, don't you want good insurance?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't need it. Never been sick. Perfect immune system.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, well, if you've never been sick, then you don't have any antibodies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't need them. Superior genes. I'm a Schrute. And superior brain power. Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why would you want to raise your cholesterol?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So I can lower it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He literally won't come out of his office.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He's got to come out sometime. To go to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin! That's inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, can I talk to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, uh, I would love to, but I am really busy. Rain check?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Michael. Michael, please, can we talk to you about this memo?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, what? Which memo?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight's health care memo. I told you about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it a good plan?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a great plan. It saves the company a fortune.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's like a pay decrease.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, he made huge cuts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cuts? What? Wow, Dwight, did you make cuts?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, you said...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no , no, you know what? I said nothing specific because I was so busy. Why don't you go in there and find these people a plan that will work for them? OK?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can handle that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK? All right. Do we feel good? All right. Good. Plus, there's some other good news. Today, at the end of the day, I will have, for all of you, a big surprise. OK? So hang in there, and I will see you at the end of the day. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is not good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's ridiculous. Did you talk to him?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You let him walk all over you. It's just pathetic.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What are you guys talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nothing, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I know what the surprise is? Hell no! It doesn't matter. The point is, they're not unhappy anymore. They're out there thinking, "Wow, my boss really cares about me. He has a surprise. He's cool. I... what a great guy. I love him. I... love him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, everyone. Gather round. Step forward. It has been brought to my attention that some of you are unhappy with my plan. So what I'd like you to do is to fill this out and write down any diseases you have that you might want covered and I'll see what I can do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, you know what Dwight? We can't write our diseases down for you because that's confidential.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, well, I didn't say to write your name down, did I? Fill it out, leave it anonymous. Or, don't write any disease down at all and it won't be covered. Sound fair? Good. I'll be in my office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Workspace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Come with me. We are going on a little mission. Operation Surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, headed out. Part of my busy day, you know. Meetings. [Giggles] Couldn't find the knob.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, basically, I want to do something nice for my employees. Atlantic City, OK? They have this thing where they send a bus, right, for free. Picks everybody up, you head down there, get to the hotel, room is comped, they give you a pile of chips, and your food, everything just kind of all-inclusive, free kind of weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Travel Agent
Quote.Text: I don't know of anything like that, but, um, you know what you might want to do, is just call those casinos directly. Um, maybe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I did, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait. What are you writing? Don't write Ebola or mad cow disease. Right? 'Cause I'm suffering from both.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm inventing new diseases.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, let's say my teeth turn to liquid and then, they drip down the back of my throat. What would you call that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought you said you were inventing diseases? That's spontaneous dental hydroplosion.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on his cell phone] Calling you to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, trying to give the troops around here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could take them down to take a spin on your big ride.

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It's not really a ride.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Its says here that it's a 300ft drop.

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: It goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So it's not a free fall?

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: It's an industrial coal elevator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, all right. Well, once you get down into the mine, what... you got laser tag or something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, so I don't know what the surprise is. Am I worried? No. No way. See, I thrive on this. This is my world. This is improv. This is Whose Line is it Anyway?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damnit! Damnit Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, who did this? I'm not mad. I just want to know who did it so I can punish them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, someone forged, uh, medical information and that is a felony.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, whoa. 'Cause that is a pretty intense accusation. How do you know that they're fake?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, leprosy? Flesh eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You did this, didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes you did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No I didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know it was you. Fine. You know what? I'll have to interview each and every one of you until the perpetrator makes him or herself known. And until that time, there will be no health care coverage for any one!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Killer nanorobots?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's an epidemic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won't receive the care they need, because someone in this office is coming up with all this ridiculous stuff. [reads off of paper] "Count Choculitis"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounds tough.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why did you write that down Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think you need to confess...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...the fact...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing? Those are my keys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good luck. [closes door and locks it]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! Damnit! No! Jim! Let me out! Jim! Let... [Without looking, Jim throws his keys to his left, they land on a shelf next to Stanley]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [looks at keys, continues talking on phone] ...the light green or green...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [answering phone] Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me out or you're fired.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you can't fire me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes I can. I'm manager for the day. Clean out your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, can you hold on? I'm getting the, ah, beep. [presses button on phone]] Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, Jim. It's Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Pam! How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! Open the door!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good, how are you? Busy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm doing OK. Getting excited for the weekend though. What are you up to?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I'm not bothering you, am I?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't have anything you're doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have nothing to do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh great. Um, no, this weekend? Nothing. I'm not really doing anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I might go to the mall.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The mall?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I need new shoes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, interesting, what kind of shoes?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, hello. Uh, this is Dwight Schrute calling for Jan Levenson-Gould.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This is Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi. Dwight Schrute calling, acting manager, Scranton branch. Listen, I needed your permission to fire Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: From sales?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Where's Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He is not here right now. He put me in charge of the office.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Dwight, listen to me very carefully. You are not a manager of anything. Understand?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not entirely true, because he put me in charge of picking the health care plan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK, when Michael gets back, you tell him to call me immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Call you immediately. Good. Oh, hey, listen, um, since I have you on the phone, um, can I fire Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No. Please don't use my cell phone ever again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, this is your cell, I thought this was your... [dial tone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, everybody, Ice-cream sandwiches! Aaaahh! [laughs] Here you go. Take one, take one. It's all good. Phyllis, think fast. Ya-bome! Oh, oh, I see Angela. Angela? Right? Waaaaah! Oh, hey temp. Why don't you take two? Because you don't get health care. And uh, faster metabolism.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Did you get the kind with the cookies? Instead of the...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you just eat it, OK? And here you go, Stanley the manly.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This isn't the big surprise, is it? Because we've been having a pretty horrible day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, nope. Nope. This isn't the surprise. It's surprising, um... because you didn't expect it. But you will... you'll know it when you see it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael. Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [under his breath] Oh, Christ.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I tried being rational, OK? And what happened? The employees went crazy, I got no help from corporate. That leaves me with no options.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm now going to read out loud your submitted medical conditions. When you hear yours read, please raise your hand to indicate that it is real. If you do not raise your hand, it will not be covered.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What about confidentiality?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? You have forfeited that privilege. I have tried to treat you all as adults, but obviously I am the only adult here. Number one, inverted penis.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Could you mean vagina? Because if you do, I want that covered.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought your vagina was removed during your hysterectomy?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: A uterus is different from a vagina. I still have a vagina.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, great. Dermatitis. Thank you Angela. I'll make sure that's covered. OK, now. Who wrote this, hysterical one? Anal fissures?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's a real thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but no one here has it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Someone has it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you think we should go ?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know, Kevin. This is important. I don't want... [spots Michael through the blinds] There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What is he doing?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, what? You could be referring to anything.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: OK, the health care plan.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why did you put Dwight in charge of that? He did a horrible job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, Dwight? Did you raise benefits?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I most certainly did not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh come on! That's horrible! Aaah... Thanks, Dwight, for a crappy plan. Ah, Damn! Oh, mmm, I wish I had time to change it, but Jan needs it by five, and... what time is it, what time is it? [looks at watch] Ah, it's after five. Oh, oh it's awful. So, well, OK. See you guys on Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What about the surprise?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... Yes. Exactly. Thank you Angela, for reminding me. Terrific. Um, before I tell everybody what the big surprise is, would you like to tell me what you think the big surprise is?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We all think you don't have a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, I have some news for you. There is a big surprise. And... here it is. Here we go. And the big surprise is... Brrrrrrrr! Drum roll... Brrrrrrrr! Brrrrrrrr!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I am backed into a corner, that is when I come alive. See I learned improve from the greats, like, um, Drew Carey and Ryan Stiles.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clapping hands] God, yeah... Ah! This...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] "Hi. I'm Mork from Ork." Well, I'm Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, um... Jan wants you to call her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [heated discussion in the 'Dwight Schrute Workspace', door opens] I did not dismiss you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, you have no right to ask those questions.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You came into my office voluntarily.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Because I don't want my benefits slashed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, maybe they won't get slashed if you answer all my questions.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm reporting you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know when ever a worker is promoted above their peers there's always going to be a little bit of jealousy. Uh, it's natural. And that's going to lead to goofing off and that's okay that's fine. As long as they are willing to suffer the consequences.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael I need to talk to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry, too busy can't even come to the door.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [opens door] Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, no... [hurries to get up from chair]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, Michael I... [blinds rustle] ... inside.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what. I, um, I'm out the door. I'm going to a meeting. Pam, I'm headed out to another meeting. So see you later. Uh, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We stole Dwight's trashcan and she found some of his early attempts at his sign.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, here's uh, this is very simple. "Dwight's Workspace," nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, this one interesting the power comes from the font in this one. "Schrute Space," very medieval, very England. Um, this one's forceful, this one's very Dwight. "Quiet! Dwight Schrute Working," it's good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I really heard him on that. This one's interesting I'm not really sure what he meant by this. Um, "Dwight Schrute Privates." Tough to say.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what, Dwight. What if you got a really serious disease like Ebola.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Psssh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it could happen. Have you ever seen the movie Outbreak?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Well, have you ever seen the movie Unbreakable? 'Cause that guy couldn't get sick, just like me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Have you ever seen the movie Sixth Sense? Maybe you are already dead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Unlikely.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You promise these are confidential?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you just mark on that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't think so, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You made a "P."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrong. [walks away] Thank you Jim. Kevin. Stanley. [whispering] Pam, Jim, Kevin, Stanley. Pam, Jim, Kevin, Stanley. You finished?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Here's the rest of them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That was... unauthorized.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it is time to call in a little favor. A buddy of mine runs this tourist attraction, actually it's big. It's probably one of the most popular in the state. So...

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on his cell phone] Hey, hey Craigers, my man! It is Michael Scott here. [silence] Dunder Mifflin, we supply your office paper.

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: Oh, I think we already did our order this month.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. No, actually to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, here's the deal. Um, trying to give the troops here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could bring them down to go on your big ride.

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It's not really a ride.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it says here that it's a 300ft drop.

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: Well, it goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So it's not a free fall?

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: It's an industrial coal elevator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, okay. So um, once you get down into the mine, what do you do? Is it like, uh... Do you have laser tag down there or something?

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: No, you just look around. It's a historically preserved coal mine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it?

Quote.Speaker: Man on Phone
Quote.Text: Well, there's the adjacent Anthracite Heritage Museum. They got some really interesting old mining tools. There's also a photo mural exhibit. Uh, bat guano sculpture. [Michael hangs up cell phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, he's a small client. They don't really buy much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why do you want health care, Pam? Hmm? Why do you want it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: In case I get sick.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you just go ahead and use Roy's health care plan, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because we're not married.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But you're engaged. Aren't you and maybe you've set a date for the wedding, hmm? And because you know you're going to get married you don't have to take our health care plan seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We haven't set a date. [Dwight laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You really expect me to believe you haven't set a date? I think you have. Sure Pam, sure. But you know what, you've been engaged for three years and I know you've set a date. And you know what else, I know you've got coverage under Roy and I know that you wrote down those fake diseases. Admit it. Admit it, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shut up, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wrote down... I didn't give you permission to.. I didn't...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not talking to you anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, I uh, I have something to confess.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're doing the right thing. Go ahead. What 's your confession?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let it out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're a jackass.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. You wanna do this the hard way. We'll do this the hard way. You wrote down those fake diseases didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Was that the hard way?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know you did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, then why are you wasting everybody else's time interrogating them?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, because I want to know who wrote those diseases down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You want you to take this pen and this piece of paper and write this down. Write this down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I, Jim Halpert...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, slow down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...confess to health care fraud.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: One second 'cause that sounds really good. Is jackass one word or two? [Dwight sighs] One, right? 'Cause, 'cause of the show, it's one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One word.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've really learned from the greats. The great improvisers, Drew Carey, Ryan Stiles, uh, the Brady guy not so much. He's more the signing, Wayne Brady. Um, Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] "Hi. I'm Mork from Ork." Well, I'm Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo. [as Robin Williams] "That's Good morning, Vietnam!" Well, hello to you. You know it would be... God. And you know what, sometimes when I'm watching somebody like um, like Jay Leno. He'll be half way through his step [snaps his fingers] And I will already be laughing at the punch line. He hasn't even gotten to it. He doesn't even know what it is it. So it's fun, you know it's fun having a mind that works like that. That is just a few steps ahead of... comedically ahead of like what's going on. Like I'll watch T.V. and I'll be watching a show and I will think, oh, I know someone's gonna walk in here right now and say something funny. And then they do. Or, um, I know they'll be like oh boy that person deserved to be slammed down. There's going to be some sort of insult. And there is. You know, there's like, "Oh you're... God your butt is fat." And I knew it. I know it's like I knew they were going to say that. I knew they were gonna go there. Don't go there. Um, but other... You know it's like uh, you know Leno, um and Letterman, Carson, you know. Need I say more? No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, um... Jan wants you to call her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're all going bowling!
